citations.narrative:
The intermediate handler failed to meet Food and Water requirements. A shipment of 500 macaques departed from the
Republic of Mauritius on the afternoon of July 6, 2025, and arrived in Miami, Florida, the morning of July 8, 2025. Flight
records document the flight departing MRU in Mauritius at 15:24 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) on July 06, 2025.
Feed and Water Logs, provided by the transporter, document the animals receiving food and water at 15:45 hrs. (time
zone not specified) on July 06, 2025. The feed and water logs document the animals next received food and water at
15:45 hrs. (time zone not specified) on July 07, 2025. No other instances of food or water being offered were
documented. Animal Welfare Regulations require these animals to be offered food at least every 24 hours and they must
be offered potable water at least every 12 hours. Water was not offered at the required frequency.
Failure to provide water at appropriate intervals can lead to dehydration or other conditions that could be harmful to the
health and well-being of the animals.
Each nonhuman primate must be offered potable water at least every 12 hours.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

narrative:
3.89(a)  Critical
   
Food and water requirements. 
The intermediate handler failed to meet Food and Water requirements. A shipment of 500 macaques departed from the 
Republic of Mauritius on the afternoon of July 6, 2025, and arrived in Miami, Florida, the morning of July 8, 2025. Flight 
records document the flight departing MRU in Mauritius at 15:24 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) on July 06, 2025. 
Feed and Water Logs, provided by the transporter, document the animals receiving food and water at 15:45 hrs. (time 
zone not specified) on July 06, 2025. The feed and water logs document the animals next received food and water at 
15:45 hrs. (time zone not specified) on July 07, 2025. No other instances of food or water being offered were 
documented. Animal Welfare Regulations require these animals to be offered food at least every 24 hours and they must 
be offered potable water at least every 12 hours. Water was not offered at the required frequency. 
 
Failure to provide water at appropriate intervals can lead to dehydration or other conditions that could be harmful to the 
health and well-being of the animals.  
 
Each nonhuman primate must be offered potable water at least every 12 hours. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n
